N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5900.9 - Appeals

State Regulations
(a) Any person
whose application to inspect and/or copy records has been denied, on any
grounds other than the grounds that the information was submitted by a person
who was granted an exception from disclosure pursuant to section
5900.7
of this Part (in which case
the appeal must be submitted pursuant to section
5900.7
[g]
), may
appeal within 30 days of such denial to Counsel, New York State Science and

Technology Foundation, 99 Washington Avenue, Albany, N.Y. 12210. Such appeal
must be in writing and must set forth: the name and address of the person
requesting the records; the date of the request for records and to whom it was
delivered; the specific records to which access was denied; the reasons given
for such denial; and whether the denial was in writing or is considered to be a
denial because of failure of the foundation to respond promptly to a request
for records. (b) The counsel to the
foundation shall, upon receipt of an appeal in compliance with this section, review the request for access to records of the foundation and affirm, modify
or reverse the denial. The counsel shall inform the person requesting access to
records of the decision, in writing, within 10 business days of receipt of a
properly filed appeal, and of his right to appeal any denial pursuant to
article 78 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules. (c) The counsel shall immediately transmit to
the Committee on Public Access to Records copies of all appeals and the
determination thereon. Such copies shall be addressed to: Committee on Public Access to Records

Department of State
162 Washington Avenue

Albany, N.Y. 12231
